result.execSummary:
The defendant QUENTIN GABRIEL HAIMA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 2. Consecutive to any other sentence.
Granted Huber if in compliance with jail regulations.
Granted Good Time. 
Transfer authorized to Outagamie County.
3 days credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence
Concurrent with: Count 2

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprint.  Contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Forfeiture and costs to be paid within 60 days from sentence date, unless payment plan is approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.
